page.title: 05THE RIVER WENT & WENT HILLS.
page.content: The River Went has its source in a spring in Featherstone. From there it flows through a wide valley until it reaches the Went Hills. It crosses Thorp Marsh, where its course has been straightened, and then through Wentbridge, where the old A1 crosses it by the bridge that gave the village its name. From there it enters a narrow valley with the limestone crags of Brockadale on the north and Smeaton Crags to the south. The waters of the River are very clean and support a wide variety of wildlife. The river is also popular with fishermen as well as with those who enjoy walking in the beautiful countryside alongside the river. There are plenty of footpaths open to the public. The present A1 crosses the valley by a viaduct.
